body.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

p.College of Community Innovation and Educ:
College of Community Innovation and Education
School of Public Administration
Dr. Phillips Academic Commons (DPAC) - UCF Downtown, 446
p.Undergraduate Programs Director: Dr. Ste:
Undergraduate Programs Director: Dr. Stephanie Krick
stephanie.krick@ucf.edu
p.Urban and regional planning is one area: Urban and regional planning is one area of public administration that has seen considerable growth over the past few years. Areas like Central Florida need many professionals who assist government, communities, and private sector planning organizations to provide growth that is environmentally feasible, aesthetically attractive, socially and politically acceptable, technically sustainable, and economically dynamic. This minor looks at all of these diverse and competing interests, and provides the basics for those interested in employment in this area of great demand. Students who pursue a minor in urban and regional planning may find positions as a city planner, urban designer, planning specialist, environmental program manager, or economic development specialist, among others.

Urban and regional planning is one area of public administration that has seen considerable growth over the past few years. Areas like Central Florida need many professionals who assist government, communities, and private sector planning organizations to provide growth that is environmentally feasible, aesthetically attractive, socially and politically acceptable, technically sustainable, and economically dynamic. This minor looks at all of these diverse and competing interests, and provides the basics for those interested in employment in this area of great demand. Students who pursue a minor in urban and regional planning may find positions as a city planner, urban designer, planning specialist, environmental program manager, or economic development specialist, among others.
Minor Admission Requirements
None

None

None

p.Students in the Minor program are strong: Students in the Minor program are strongly encouraged to take the following courses as electives to enhance their understanding of the field.

li.PAD 4390 - Hazard Mitigation and Prepare: PAD 4390 - Hazard Mitigation and Preparedness Credit Hours: 3
li.PAD 4392 - Emergency Management and Home: PAD 4392 - Emergency Management and Homeland Security Credit Hours: 3
li.PAD 4803 - Issues in Urban Administratio: PAD 4803 - Issues in Urban Administration Credit Hours: 3
li.Students must earn a \"C-\" (1.75) or be: Students must earn a "C-" (1.75) or better in each course in the minor.
li.Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0: Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0 in the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship or Independent Study credit c: Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior approval.

courseSection1.text:
Suggested Courses

Students in the Minor program are strongly encouraged to take the following courses as electives to enhance their understanding of the field.

PAD 4390 - Hazard Mitigation and Preparedness Credit Hours: 3
PAD 4392 - Emergency Management and Homeland Security Credit Hours: 3
PAD 4803 - Issues in Urban Administration Credit Hours: 3
PAD 4822 - Intergovernmental Administration Credit Hours: 3

Foreign Language Requirements

None

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements

Students must earn a "C-" (1.75) or better in each course in the minor.
Students must earn an overall GPA of 2.0 in the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior approval.
